docs.lead_paragraph: A free program in the Bronx offers a workshop for students in their late teens and early 20s who might otherwise be ill equipped to navigate financial pitfalls.

headline.seo: Financial Literacy Class Offers Skills Not Taught in School
headline.main: Back to Classroom for Skills Not Taught in High School
headline.print_headline: Back to Classroom for Skills Not Taught in High School

docs.abstract: Community Service Society of New York, through the nonprofit organization New Settlement Apartments, offers a free workshop in the Bronx for students in their late teens and early 20s to teach skills for financial literacy.
docs.snippet: A free program in the Bronx offers a workshop for students in their late teens and early 20s who might otherwise be ill equipped to navigate financial pitfalls.

docs.lead_paragraph: Jean-Claude Mas, the founder of a French company that used substandard silicone in thousands of breast implants, was released on bail on Friday.

headline.seo: Jean-Claude Mas, Breast Implant Maker, Is Under Formal Investigation
headline.main: Founder of Breast Implant Company Under Formal Investigation
headline.print_headline: Founder of Breast Implant Company Under Formal Investigation

docs.abstract: Jean-Claude Mas, founder of French company Poly Implants Protheses, which is at the center of an international scandal over substandard breast implants, is placed under formal criminal investigation in connection with the case of a woman who died of a rare form of cancer after her implants ruptured.
docs.snippet: Jean-Claude Mas, the founder of a French company that used substandard silicone in thousands of breast implants, was released on bail on Friday.

byline.original: By DAVID JOLLY and MAÏA DE LA BAUME

docs.lead_paragraph: 1/27/12 | Updated Headline adjusted to more accurately reflect the article. If you've seen your health insurance premiums increase along with your deductible, you're not alone. A recent study by the Commonwealth Fund shows just how much more consumers are paying for employer-provided health insurance.
docs.abstract: Bucks blog notes Commonwealth Fund study finds total health insurance premiums for family coverage rose 50 percent from 2003 to 2010, to nearly $14,000 a year; notes employee premiums for family-plan coverage in 2010 averaged about $3,700, up from $2,300 in 2003. (M)g

headline.main: Santorum's Attacks on Romney Health Plan Could Help Democrats

docs.abstract: If Democrats wants a step-by-step instruction manual for how they might try to neutralize Mitt Romney on the health care issue, they might want to watch Rick Santorum's coldly efficient critique.

docs.lead_paragraph: More Americans older than 55 are being imprisoned, and many prisons are unprepared to provide them with health care, Human Rights Watch said in a new report.

headline.seo: Older Prisoners Mean Rising Health Costs, Study Finds
headline.main: Number of Older Inmates Grows, Stressing Prisons
headline.print_headline: Number of Older Inmates Grows, Stressing Prisons

docs.abstract: Human Rights Watch reports the number of Americans in prison older than 55 is growing at a faster rate than the group’s share of the population at large, and many prisons are unprepared to provide them with health care, which can cost as much as nine times more than for younger inmates.
docs.snippet: More Americans older than 55 are being imprisoned, and many prisons are unprepared to provide them with health care, Human Rights Watch said in a new report.

docs.lead_paragraph: The competition between Mitt Romney and Newt Gingrich dominated the last debate before the Florida primary, as the two angrily traded charges on Thursday over their immigration policies and financial holdings.

headline.main: Romney Stays on the Offense With Gingrich
headline.print_headline: Romney Stays On the Offense With Gingrich

docs.abstract: Mitt Romney, facing his greatest challenge of the campaign, relentlessly presses Newt Gingrich in their final debate before the Florida primary, seeking to regain the offensive against an insurgent challenge that has shaken his claim to inevitability; gives his rival no quarter on the grand ideas that have been Gingrich's trademark; delivers sharp lines that give him an advantage usually held by his opponent; Ron Paul and Rick Santorum find few moments to promote their agendas.
docs.snippet: The competition between Mitt Romney and Newt Gingrich dominated the last debate before the Florida primary, as the two angrily traded charges on Thursday over their immigration policies and financial holdings.

byline.contributor: Richard A. Oppel Jr. contributed reporting.
byline.original: By JIM RUTENBERG and JEFF ZELENY

docs.lead_paragraph: J. B. Holmes is back playing golf on the PGA Tour after having brain surgery last year to relieve symptoms of Chiari malformations, which caused vertigo-like dizziness.

headline.seo: After Brain Surgery, J. B. Holmes Getting Back to Basics on PGA Tour
headline.main: Getting Back to Basics After Brain Surgery
headline.print_headline: Getting Back to Basics After Brain Surgery

docs.abstract: J B Holmes has returned to the PGA Tour after having brain surgery in 2011.
docs.snippet: J. B. Holmes is back playing golf on the PGA Tour after having brain surgery last year to relieve symptoms of Chiari malformations, which caused vertigo-like dizziness.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Pentagon took the first major step toward shrinking after a decade of war, announcing a proposal for budget cuts that is fraught with political risk.

headline.seo: Pentagon Cuts Would Affect Raises, Insurance and Base Closings
headline.main: Defense Budget Cuts Would Limit Raises and Close Bases
headline.print_headline: Pentagon Says Cuts Would Affect Raises, Health Plan and Base Closings

docs.abstract: Pentagon takes the first major step toward shrinking its budget after a decade of war, announcing that it wants to limit pay raises for troops, increase health insurance fees for military retirees and close bases in the United States; Defense Secretary Leon E Panetta says he is working with about $500 billion less than he had anticipated having on hand through 2017, meaning that the Pentagon had to trim personnel and favorite high-profile weapons programs.
docs.snippet: The Pentagon took the first major step toward shrinking after a decade of war, announcing a proposal for budget cuts that is fraught with political risk.
